param.para: A pointer that receives a new instance.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Retrieves a list of GUIDs that signify which pixel formats the converter supports.

param.name: cFormats
param.para: The size of the pPixelFormatGUIDs array.

param.name: pPixelFormatGUIDs
param.para: Pointer to a GUID array that receives the pixel formats the converter supports.

param.name: pcActual
param.para: The actual array size needed to retrieve all pixel formats supported by the converter.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The format converter does not necessarily guarantee symmetricality with respect to conversion; that is, a converter may be able to convert FROM a particular format without actually being able to convert TO a particular format. In order to test symmetricality, use .

To determine the number of pixel formats a converter can handle, set cFormats to 0 and pPixelFormatGUIDs to NULL. The converter will fill pcActual with the number of formats supported by that converter.

summary.para: Exposes methods that provide information about a pixel format converter.
